boardgame.name: Village War: The Calamity
boardgame.description:
Village War: The Calamity is a card-drafting, resource management, and spirit war game. The theme and narration is a combination of the history, folklore, myths and our fantasy of the Igbo tribe in Nigeria, Africa.

During game set-up, players each take their own village (including 10 different warriors, 11 resources which are selected randomly, 3 artifacts, and their wall). Warriors are different, and some of them possess unique powers to form combos during the war! And the artifacts are gifts from the gods with fierce powers. As players, you also have the chance to buy new artifacts during gameplay. Your aim is to win the battle and earn more resources as tributes paid from other players. The player with the most VPs — a sum of tributes collected and warrior power rank — wins.

Village War: The Calamity is the first of a five-game series that exposes the Igbo culture more than any other game in history. The game story (12 pages) narrates the inspirations behind the artwork and the story, and the game features masquerades, Priest(ess), and other creatures with Igbo origin in mind. The pulisher also had a live studio record for the game to create the right melody creating a 65-minutes "Igbo War music" instrumental for that extra experience.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battle of Adrica: Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Adrica is a dice rolling, area control, resource management and soldier elimination game where players take on the role of commanders in charge of their battalion as they are tasked to secure different location in Adrica based on the natural resources in the region.

It was inspired by a make-believe world of what could have happened if the Berlin Conference for the scramble of Africa was not peaceful among the colonials.

Please note: This is a stand-alone game from the previous base-game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Game of Presidents
boardgame.description:
The deck of cards consists of an "A" and "B" card for each of the 27 presidents included. The A card has the dates of his presidency, his political party and his birth and death dates; the B card lists a varying number of significant events of his life or his presidential terms.

Some cards have two presidents on them, presumably because they wanted to include all of them up to the current one at the time of manufacture (Herbert Hoover) while preserving the 54-card deck.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pays de Rennes: Le Jeu !
boardgame.description:
Le Jeu du Pays de Rennes is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.
Nearly 1000 written and visual questions deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current affairs or famous people which marked the Pays de Rennes.


Le Jeu du Pays de Rennes est un jeu de société original, local et convivial basé sur le principe des questions – réponses.
Près de 1000 questions écrites et visuelles traitent de sujets aussi variés que l'Histoire ou la géographie, le patrimoine, les traditions locales, l'actualité ou les personnages célèbres qui ont marqué le Pays de Rennes.

boardgame.name: The Three Little Wolves
三隻小狼
boardgame.description:
Centuries after a famous story featuring three little pigs, the Swine family has learned a precious lesson and become the greatest landlord in the world. (They love houses!) The Wolf family, however, has become the best architects of all time. (They hate lousy houses!) The three little wolves now work for the Big Bad Pig to build all kinds of houses. Can you help the wolves build the highest house and find the best home for them?

Three Little Wolves is a family game in which each player needs to build three houses by playing cards from small numbers to large. The higher you build, the better the chance you can score points — but your fellow players might send their little wolves to live in your nice house for big points! Plans, disguises, and a pinch of luck in your hand are all you need to win the game!

In more detail, players take turns playing one card from hand to build one of the three houses — blue, green, and red — in front of themselves, then refill their hand to four cards. If the Big Bad Pig (BBP) is drawn, it rewards the tallest house at that moment, but if you can't keep the house tall enough at the end of the game, you will get punished. If you don't want to play a card, you can discard a card and send one of your three wolves to live in other players' houses for a chance to score points!

The third time the BBP rewards the tallest house triggers the end of the game. All players compare the height of their buildings, and the shortest of each color is knocked down by the BBP! Whoever scores the most points wins!

boardgame.name: Random Roads: The Defense of Steadholt
boardgame.description:
"Random Roads is an answer to an age-old question for Dungeon Masters: How do I make 2d4 goblins busting out of the forest interesting? Travel is such a common part of Dungeons and Dragon, but it can be a divisive issue. Some players love having the chance to break out the dice and have some combat without the weight of the plot dragging it down. Other players would rather the DM skip to the next town so the story can keep going. Random Roads hopes to fill the needs of both these types of players, by providing short road adventures that see combat players rolling their dice and role players roleing their roles. Random Roads is built for groups of all levels, with a scaling guide and hooks for any wizard of the coast adventures to help the DM drop these paths in front of any party.

Down this road: Sometimes a group of monsters gets to large for just a group of heroes to deal with. In this adventure the heroes find themselves caught in the mists are a small war between a mercenary company and a horde of monster led by an antagonist known as The Butcher. Even worst for the heroes they seem to be trapped behind emeny lines.

A combat heavy set of encounters where the heroes try and defend a small compund.
Built to be run with groups of every level.
Inculdes a handful of new or redesinged monsters for exciting encounters."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: The Journal of the Travellers' Aid Society Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to the Journal of the Travellers’ Aid Society, your indispensable guide to adventuring in the Far Future.

Each volume is a treasure trove of information and game additions for Traveller, including adventures, new ships, alien creatures from across Charted Space, philosophical musings on the big empires, histories, different takes on familiar equipment, new vehicles, characters to be met in starports, playable alien races, and much, much more...

Amongst the many articles in Volume One, you will find:

Burst Lasers, the midway turret weapon between Pulse and Beam Lasers
Guides to piracy and smuggling in the Spinward Marches
New variants of the trusty ATV that will get you across any rough ground
The Delphinus Starliner, to travel in absolute comfort
A look at the Two Thousand worlds of the K’kree
The Dynchia, fully playable humanoid aliens

boardgame.name: Breakthrough: Tanks
boardgame.description:
Breakthrough is a strategy game where two tank armies fight each other. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the other end of the board (break through the enemy’s frontline). It has some similarity to Checkers, but the strategy is completely different.

Each team consists of the following units:
2 heavy tanks
4 tank destroyers
10 medium tanks

The game is played with 1:200 scale models. A blue German army fights against a green Soviet one.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
The original Breakthrough is a strategy game invented by Dan Troyka. This version focuses on two tank armies fight each other with some modifications to the rules. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the other end of the board (break through the enemy’s front line). It has some similarity to Checkers, but the strategy is completely different. The tanks are realistic 1:200 scale models in green and blue color. Material: environmentally friendly PLA plastic
SHIPPING: $6 to anywhere in the world Contents: - 2x German heavy tank - 4x German tank destroyer - 10x German medium tank - 2x Soviet heavy tank - 4x Soviet tank destroyer - 10x Soviet medium tank - printed rulebook - rules in PDF format
The game is usually played on a 8x8 square board. If you don't have a board, you can draw or simply print one. This is the best printable 8x8 board that I found online: https://www.printchess.com/download-printable-paper-chess-set/ I can print this board for you and send it with the game if you'd like, just tell me when you order!

boardgame.name: Feindbild: Das Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
The world is very confusing. It's good if you then have a clear picture of the enemy! Stage your image of the enemy with the right campaign for the right target group and clear away the image of the enemy in a politically correct manner.

"Feindbild" ("Enemy stereotype") - this is a unique game concept in which the fun of the game scratches the satire. The game can be explained in a few minutes. But you can play it for years. Provided, of course, that our enemy stereotypes do not change by then.

Every player gets a target group to work for. Then five images of the enemy are laid out. And then it is important to stage the enemy images with the right media campaign in such a way that the anger of your own target group begins to boil. And that's about it. Isn't it nice when card games can be explained so easily?

As enemy images there are the bad Russians, the classic terrorists, the scruffy social parasite, the greedy pharmaceutical industry and the corrupt European politician. And of course many more. The target groups are the conservatives, the left and the right and of course the totally confused aluminum hat wearers. And as campaigns there is the regulars' table, the focus on television and the daily press. And of course the satirical portals themselves. That closes the circle.

As is usual with card games, you have to spend money on "Feindbild" in order to play it. Yes, we live in evil capitalism. Another enemy image. The game consists of 106 cards, which consist of 18 enemy images, 8 target groups and 80 campaigns. And there are also instructions for use.

boardgame.name: Odkrywcy: Sahara
boardgame.description:
Journey to distant Africa. Discover hot desert, life giving river Nil and hidden in the sand Oasis. Meet incredible animals, which lives there. Don't be fooled by mirages and remember about magic talismans, which can change Your faith.

This is a simple square tile placing game where each corner can have a different color which have to match when placing the tiles next to one another. Players score immediately after placing their tile and moves their pawn on scoring track based on the number of connecting animals with additional points matching animal kind, plus star symbols.
Each player has set of special tokens allowing unique actions. After using special action mysterious oasis tile is added to the game by the active player. To reveal it needs to be surrounded from all sides. When flipped over it adds or reduces points based on animals around it - whenever it turns out to be a mirage or actual oasis.

boardgame.name: Hellfrost Resource Management 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

WHAT SORT OF RULER WILL YOU BE?

Whether you want to adopt a noble title and run a village, take up the mantle of high priest in a temple, command a loyal mercenary company, or invest your hard-earned savings in running an inn, this book is for you!

This expanded sourcebook for Hellfrost includes:


Creating a Resource and growing in through business, diplomacy, and warfare through Ruler Actions.



Annual Events representing how the wider world impacts on your Resource.



A streamlined combat system for defending your Resource or taking the fight to your enemies.



Rules for creating your Resource’s neighbors, be they fair or foul.



Resource Miracles



Appendix covering the Land of Fire.


Hellfrost Resouce Management 2nd Edition is a source book bringing together previously published material and new expanded information for the epic Hellfrost setting for the awardwinning Savage Worlds RPG.

boardgame.name: 1812 Argentina
boardgame.description:
In 1812 Manuel Belgrano created the flag of Argentina, but nobody knows the real story behind it... until now.

OBJECTIVE
In this game, the AUTHOR and the READERS must work together as a team.
READERS have to guess the secret code that the AUTHOR has inside the book before the turns are over.

AUTHOR: The AUTHOR must guide the READERS to discover the facts. He/She must do so without speaking and using only images.
He/She will try to relate the AUTHOR CARDS to the READER CARDS as indicated by the secret code.

READERS: They should relate the AUTHOR CARDS to the READERS CARDS given by the AUTHOR and use their intuition to be able to correctly interpret his/her message.

Players win if READERS guess the AUTHOR's secret code before turns are over.
Players lose if READERS fail to guess AUTHOR's secret code before turns are over.

Back of the box description:
En 1812 Manuel Belgrano creó la bandera argentina. Pero hasta el día de hoy, la verdadera historia permanece oculta. ¿Con quién la creó? ¿En qué lugar de Argentina? ¿Qué comieron?
1812 Argentina es un juego de comunicación e interpretación de imágenes que permite redescubrir en cada partida estos hechos. Un jugador encarnará el rol de "autor" y deberá guiar a los "lectores" mediante imágenes para que descubran lo sucedido en 1812.

boardgame.name: Razorhurst
boardgame.description:
Sydney, Australia in the 1920s is a hotbed of crime and vice. The inner city suburbs of Darlinghurst and Surry Hills are a battleground between warring gangs led by prostitute Tilly Devine and sly grog queen Kate Leigh. And in the middle of it all is you, a detective for the New South Wales Police, just trying to solve the crimes and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Razorhurst is a story-driven detective game similar to Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. You will interview suspects, follow leads, and use your abilities for observation, persuasion and force. Razorhurst introduces a unique clock mechanic for affecting the player's abilities. But the main difference with other detective games is that in Razorhurst everything is real. You will be investigating actual crimes, tracking down historical evidence, and bringing actual killers to justice. Based on exhaustive research, Razorhurst allows the player to step back in time to one of the most heady and deadly places in history.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Root: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Root, and The Riverfolk, The Underworld, The Exiles & Partisans Deck, The Vagabond Pack and Resin Clearing Markers.

The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The insert is arranged in three layers.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 22.6 x 29.0 x 7.4cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Root: The Exiles and Partisans Deck

boardgame.name: Blackacre Orchard
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An estate improperly acquired, an orchard besieged by vengeful spirits and decay, a labrynth of trees and a haunted house. Blackacre Orchard was once the producer of the finest apples and cider in the Marches, but no longer- now it lay abandoned, with foul beings prowling its tree rows and manor halls.

The estate much be purged of such evils, or the evils appeased with the life of the one who wronged them, if the cider is the flow freely once more. Whether the new owner, Tostein, or the widow of the prior owner, Amalia, survives the night depends on the actions of the player Character, but either way a warm cup of cider awaits them once the job is done.

boardgame.name: Star Realms: Cardbox
boardgame.description:
The 400 count Cardbox will have 224 sleeves and some promo cards (depends on deck box version).


STR982 comes with three Star Realms: Mercenary Garrison Promo Card
STR983 comes with one Star Realms: Merc Battlecruiser Promo Card

boardgame.name: DinoGenics: Controlled Chaos – Ammonite meeples
boardgame.description: The Ammonite meeples are a two-piece cosmetic add-on set that works in conjunction with the Ammonite Aquarium. To be clear, there are two Ammonite Aquarium facility tiles that already come standard with all copies of Controlled Chaos. The meeples in this add-on are simply a bit of fun window dressing that you can place on top of the facilities for some extra flair.

boardgame.name: Einkaufen macht Spass!
boardgame.description:
In this game, the children playfully learn the first quantities and numbers related to shopping.

Each player gets a list which things to shop in a supermarket.
On your turn, you roll the dice and advance as many steps in the supermarket. If you end in front of a shelf in which you find one of the things from your shopping list, you have to name the shelf and the number of things on your list. For example: "I'm standing in front of the fruit shelf and I'm taking three bananas." If you named everything correctly, you're allowed to put the corresponding token on your shopping list.

The player who completes his or her shopping list first, wins.

boardgame.name: Kanban EV: Upgrade Pack
Канбан. Электро: Набор улучшений
boardgame.description:
This pack contains two separate expansions:

boardgame.name: Ambush!: A Fast-Paced Game of Strategy and Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
Ambush is a fast-paced, fantasy-themed strategy card game with exciting, dynamic gameplay centered around a cast of colorful characters with different abilities. Ambush seeks to provide the perfect blend of thrilling action and intense strategy in a game where the tide of battle can be turned in the blink of an eye! Take control of your personal castle and craft the perfect army of goblins, wizards, and knights to attack your opponents and defend your own walls from harm. The goal of the game is to be the last castle standing at the end of the hectic free-for-all.

To do this, players will need to plan and strategize for the Ambush phase, where any card played in the game so far is up for grabs in a mad scramble that has a chance to be triggered at the start of every player’s turn. Having the speed and reflexes to grab the best cards first, as well as remembering where the best cards are on the field will be critical in obtaining the upper hand over other players.

Ambush was created as a project for a USC Games class in the fall of 2019 by Michael Ford, Brendan Tighe, Masato Lin, and Tongwei Dai. The team saw some incredible potential in the game, and in the Spring of 2020,a portion of the group reformed and set out to publish and sell the game with the help of USC faculty and developers from other board game start-ups.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pocket Paragons: Origins
boardgame.description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously. Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 original characters in the world of Pocket Paragons. Featuring Pallash, Sadoh, Mata, Kagemusha, Kairos, and Rosher.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rulebreaker
boardgame.description:
The main rule is to follow the rules, but to win you’re probably going to have to break them! REBEL WITH A CAUSE...be the first to discard all the cards in your hand. As many as you want. As fast as you want. All you have to do is lay them in numerical order...subject to the RULES. You see, as you play, your discards are always subject to certain RULES. Chance upon a RULEBREAKER card, and shake things up with a new RULE! Are you winning? Are you losing? Always too soon to tell.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Numenera Character Portfolio
boardgame.description:
From the back:
A lot can happen in a campaign. The Numenera Character Portfolio is a character sheet and so much more. It records your character’s pools, abilities, skills, cyphers, and all your other stats and character info. At 24 pages, it also gives you room for notes, sketches, and details. Jot down thoughts about your character’s appearance and mannerisms. Take notes about the strange and wondrous locations, people, creatures, and objects you meet in your adventures. Keep a campaign journal, or make maps and sketches of places you’ve been.
The Numenera Character Portfolio is perfectly sized to give you plenty of space within, but without taking up too much space on the gaming table. It’s printed in full color on heavy matte paper that takes pencil and eraser easily. Even the cover is easy to write and draw on, making every player’s Character Portfolio unique from the outside in.

Normally sold in a 5 pack

boardgame.name: The Merchant
boardgame.description:
The Merchant - Mörk Borg Cult

From the introduction:

Said to have come from a wealthy mercantile bloodline, Mikhael’s family were crucified before his eyes for a heretical crime long forgotten.

A foul priestess extended her hand and offered him mercy; “Repent for the sins of your family and be forgiven by the Dark Spider, Harbinger of the end.”

boardgame.name: A Midwinter Night's Nightmare
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Vadim and Vasilisa are the descendants of adventuring folk: Vadim’s father defeated Krampus years ago and Vasilisa’s mother kept the family safe with her witchcraft. However, Vadim and Vasilisa have turned their backs on the heroic life, which has in part led to their predicament. Vadim and Vasilisa have brought upon their family the wrath of a winter spirit, the Krampus, who resides in the nearby barrow. This was triggered when Vasilisa turned away a beggar, the elf Morozko. Morozko sheltered in the family’s Timber Store and, when Nikita, the young daughter of the family, took pity on him, he encouraged her to steal a snowglobe from the barrow.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Flee
boardgame.description:
The dungeon deck consists of 104 cards representing six dungeon levels, monsters, treasures, traps, doors, empty corridors, dead ends and stairs up. While exploring a nearby dungeon, you found a horde of monsters planning something big for your nearby village. You were attacked and fell off a ledge in to the void. Left for dead by the monsters, you now have to make your way out of the dungeon and back to your village. You have no ideas where you are or how to get out but you have to escape and your are running out of time. Each corridor you take could lead you closer to the exit or directly into a dead end. Keep running and if you hit a dead end turn around and continue running. You can't stop and you must escape. Each turn presents new dangers and possible treasures. If you can survive long enough to make it through four stairs up you escape the dungeon alive. Take too long or hit too many dead ends and you may never make it out alive.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:

In addition to a big storage box for your fighters, Unleashed comes with tuckboxes and base sets to bring BattleCON: War and BattleCON: Fate up to the high component standard set in Trials. In total, it includes:
30 tuckboxes (for all fighters from Fate and War, plus Borneo and Juto)

~95 cards to Update Fate, War, and Trials
All stretch and social goal content unlocked during the campaign.

One additional solo fighter (Himel) was made available in the Empyreal: Far Corners Pledge Manager alongside the Grand Chronicle and errata cards for BattleCON: Unleashed.

boardgame.name: Monster Jam: Path of Destruction
boardgame.description:
Monster Jam: Path of Destruction is a racing video game based on the USHRA monster truck series that was made by Activision. It was the fourth edition in the series, the previous release being Monster Jam: Urban Assault. Monster Jam: Path of Destruction was released on November 9, 2010 in North America and on November 12 in Europe and the United Kingdom.[50]

The game features 28 licensed Monster Jam trucks. A new feature allows players to customize their own trucks with more than 1,000 parts. The game's multiplayer functions are head-to-head like the previous games.

On July 28, 2010, Activision announced the title of the game is "Monster Jam: Path of Destruction". Dennis Anderson, along with Tom Meents, George Balhan, Lupe Soza and Scott Douglass provided voice overs.

from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Monster_Jam_video_game...:_Path_of_Destruction

boardgame.name: The Museum Village 19th Century Americana Tour Game
boardgame.description:
A roll and move game for two to four people.The goal is to strategically move your pawns such that they share specific spaces in order to gain a souvenir card. This is done by rolling one die on your turn and moving one of your two pawns. The path recreates that of Old Mmuseum Village of Smith's Clove, a mile west of the Village of Monroe, NY., opened in 1950. The game ends when all pawns have reached the end of the path. The player with the most tickets is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Save the Queen!
boardgame.description:
"Our new Queen is finding us a new home after her statement with her rival. As a member of her royal guard, we must protect her. The problem is she is so fast and always finds her way into trouble!"

Save the Queen!

In Save the Queen! you are a royal guard sent to protect the Queen Bee as you search for a new home. Defeat other insects as you compete for territories, but bee careful; you only have so much nectar and so much time to get to a new home before the colony dies.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Navigate through cards valued between 1 and 3 territories, with increased difficulty for each value.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Power Void
boardgame.description:
"The Monarch has died and has left a Power Void; splitting the Factions.
“Which Faction will reign supreme?"

This is a simple idea that has branched out of Frog Solitaire and Save the Queen!

Mixing the premise of peg Solitaire and the movements of Save the Queen! In Power Void, you must seek the demise of your foes through murder, suggestion, and fratricide, to become the next Monarch.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Each game is randomized thanks to the use of a bag.

Files can be found at:

boardgame.name: Virallinen MM 97 jääkiekkopeli
boardgame.description:
The Official 1997 ICE Hockey World Championship game. It is tactical dice driven game for two players.

It has all the main elements of ice hockey. More goals and some times set wins achieved player wins the game. There is also possibility to the stalemate.

Players try to make more goals than opponent. Game is played in special icehockey looking game board with different symbols and places for five icehockey players and goalkeeper in each team. Also board has movement symbols which are used by turns depending to dice rolls. There is some randomness with hidden marks in game board that players try to find. This are shot, missed shot, tackle, offside, break, block, empty, goal , set win and joker.

boardgame.name: 2020 R-A-N-D-O-M Design Challenge Entries
boardgame.description: The annual collection of random tables from the wonderful folks on RPG Geek.

boardgame.name: Band Grab
boardgame.description:
Band Grab is a fast-paced music-themed strategy card game where players race to collect a winning set of groovy musician cards for their band.
Players can steal band members, recruit powerful supporters and play game-changing event cards along their journey to playing their band's first gig. But to play a gig, a player's band must first contain musician cards with enough matching genre icons.
While the simple structure of this card game is easy-to-learn for a wide range of ages and abilities, there is plenty of scope for careful scheming, tense retaliation and varied replayability!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Це Бізнес Крихітка
Это Бизнес Детка
boardgame.description:
Це Бізнес Крихітка ("This is Business Baby") is a board game with unique mechanics for those who want to learn financial literacy, improve their time management skills, and plunge into the world of entrepreneurship.

The game has a completely unique methodology and is based on the "win-win" strategy, where the most important thing is not victory, but the analysis of your actions during the game and interaction with other players.

In a playful way, you:

learn about the methods of earning;
organize your own business;
get the necessary skills to start your own business;
understand the importance of the resource of time;
train your creative thinking skills;
make your dream come true.

boardgame.name: Aeon's End: Outcasts – Neoprene Play Mat
boardgame.description: A Player Mat for Aeon's End: Outcasts

boardgame.name: Snowball
boardgame.description:
The game is played on an 8x8 board. There are two players: White and Blue. Each player has 16 Discs that are arranged on their second and third rows, respectively.

A Disc moves by taking a single step in any direction to an empty space. A Disc may also hop over a single, friendly piece to the empty space just beyond. But it may not hop over an enemy piece.

A Disc captures enemy pieces by withdrawal. This means if a Disc begins its turn with an enemy Disc adjacent, it may take a single step backwards, in the opposite direction, to the empty space just behind it. The enemy Disc is then removed from the board.

For its first turn, White makes one move, followed by Blue making two moves; White then makes three moves, and so on – creating a “Snowball Effect” of moves.

The player who eliminates all of his opponent’s pieces wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Clash of Steel
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

LET SLIP THE DOGS OF WAR!

Through Edges and Glory rewards, Hellfrost allows the heroes to become leaders of men. The playground for such characters is not the “dungeon” environment, but the open battlefield. They lead companies to death or glory beneath fluttering banners, not skulk in dark shadows searching moldy corpses for a few coins. The call to arms has been issued, but are you ready to engage in the Clash of Steel?

Instead of standard tabletop adventures, this adventure pack contains four Mass Battles scenarios. Although designed as standalone events, the GM can easily work them into an existing campaign. Also included is an alternate set of rules for running very large-scale battles on the tabletop. Now the players can literally control the actions of their troops and watch the battle unfold before their eyes. More importantly, it allows characters to use many of their regular Edges and still play a crucial role in determining the outcome of the encounter.

Hellfrost™ is an epic fantasy setting for the award winning Savage Worlds™ roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Schrecken der Vergangenheit
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Ein uralter Schrecken bedroht Heligioland!

Der Todesfürst Helfried erweckte auf seinen Reisen in den Norden die Leichen einiger Thrymreißer, schrecklicher Diener des Eiskönigs, zum Leben und hetzte diese blutrünstigen Wesen auf die Sterblichen. Doch nun trachtet er danach, die Heerscharen seiner Herrin um einen noch mächtigen Diener Thryms zu bereichern.

Auf ihrer Reise durch das sommerliche Heligioland werden die Helden von einem ungewöhnlich starken Schneesturm überrascht und suchen Schutz und Unterkunft im Dorf Skuggiheim. Sie ahnen nicht, dass sie so dem schrecklichen Spiel des mächtigen Nekromanten auf die Schliche kommen.Und so müssen die Helden hinaus in das eisige Unwetter, sich den Plänen des Priesters und seines untoten Gefolges entgegenstellen, um das Heligioland vor einer noch mächtigeren Bedrohung zu bewahren.

Schrecken der Vergangenheit von Christian Bender und Martin Schmidt ist das erste große deutsche Abenteuer für das epische Fantasysetting Hellfrost, einer Erweiterung für das preisgekrönte Rollenspiel Savage Worlds.
---
An ancient horror threatens Heligioland!

On his travels to the north, the Death Lord Helfried brought the bodies of some Thrymreißer, terrible servants of the Ice King, back to life and set these bloodthirsty creatures upon mortals. But now he seeks to enrich his mistress' hosts with an even more powerful servant of Thrym.

On their journey through the summery Heligioland, the heroes are surprised by an unusually strong snowstorm and seek shelter in the village of Skuggiheim. Unbeknownst to them, the heroes are caught up in the terrible game of the mighty necromancer, and so the heroes have to go out into the icy storm to oppose the plans of the priest and his undead retinue to save Heligioland from an even more powerful threat.

"Schrecken der Vergangenheit" by Christian Bender and Martin Schmidt is the first major German adventure for the epic fantasy setting Hellfrost, an expansion for the award-winning role-playing game Savage Worlds.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

boardgame.name: Воображарий: Россия
boardgame.description:
Воображарий: Россия ("Imagination: Russia") is a special edition of a Russian party superhit. Each card contains typical Russian things to be described and the active player will be trying to do that in 1 minute by speaking, drawing, or performing. Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game wins!

Сможете ли вы напеть русскую народную песню или нарисовать выражение «в Тулу со своим самоваром»? А помните ли, чем знаменит Алёша Попович, — и, что важнее, удастся ли вам это изобразить?
«Воображарий: Россия» — особая версия разговорного хита для весёлой и находчивой компании. На каждой карте вы найдёте задания, связанные с культурой, географией и историей нашей страны. Каждый ход игрока-ведущего ждёт вызов: всего за 1 минуту ему придётся объяснить другим участникам задание с карты при помощи сказа складного, представления молчаливого или рисунка дивного. Проявите изобретательность, смекалку и чувство юмора — и победа у вас в кармане!

boardgame.name: Brainbox: Sport
boardgame.description:
Did you know table tennis has 300 million players worldwide? Or that the first Rugby World Cup was won by New Zealand? This BrainBox includes fascinating facts about almost every sport you have heard of and maybe a few you haven’t!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a dice. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Contents: 71 cards, 2 rules cards, 1 sand timer and 1 dice. Packed in a sturdy cool magnetic cube box.

boardgame.name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #57 – General Soleimani
boardgame.description:
Target: Soleimani

Qasem Soleimani was a general in Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, and the commander of the elite Quds Force, a unit responsible for international covert ops. Due to his terrorist activities, Soleimani was sanctioned by the United Nations and European Union, and designated a terrorist by the United States. Under Soleimani's command, the Quds Force was responsible for killing hundres of US service members with IED attacks and ambushes.
You now have the mission to take out this clear and present danger to US forces in the region. This expansion provides you with several mission profiles to choose from to accomplish this vital mission. Good hunting!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Cannabis Trip: The Chilled Spliff Rolling Game
boardgame.description:
The first player throws the dice and moves onto the board starting at the central YELLOW HUB SPACE.
Players travel in a clockwise direction around each leaf in any order they wish and when they have collected all five spliffs they make their way to the BIG SPLIFF SPACE.
Whichever player arrives there first with all five spliff cards, forming a complete spliff is the winner.

boardgame.name: Cynowy szlak
Tinners' Trail
boardgame.description:
In Tinners' Trail, set in 19th century Cornwall, you represent a mining conglomerate at the height of the tin and copper mining industry. You must buy plots of land across Cornwall in auctions and survey them for tin and copper, always managing your "work points" and money effectively.

Once you have a mine in place, it's time to extract the ore and (ideally) make a profit, but the deeper your mine goes, the more expensive the process gets. To reduce the cost of mining, you can place developments, such as ports, train stations, and adits (drainage tunnels), but there's only so many improvements to go around. Once you have made your money — trying to time the market to sell when prices are high — you can invest it in industries outside of Cornwall, which gains you victory points. The earlier you invest, the better the return. Can you outplay the competition and make the most money, or will you be left without two shillings to rub together?

This edition of Tinners' Trail differs from the original 2008 version in several ways. The player count, for example, is now 1-5 instead of 3-4, and the resources on the board are now set up via tiles instead of die rolls to maintain variability while reducing the randomness. Dual-use cards are now an important part of the game, giving you information before an auction or an extra boost after an auction.

With lead development and expansion designs by David Digby

Title: Tinner's Trail Publisher: Alley Cat Games

boardgame.name: Spirits of Pallowen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The leaves have turned and the last of the crops is being brought in from the fields, which means it’s time to start preparations for Pallowen, the festival of the frightful harvest! At the Cantrip Cantina, patrons and staff are dressing up and passing out a brand new batch of arcane alcohols specially created by Arleena Rindaloo and inspired by everyone’s favorite spooky season.

And because Arleena could never forget about those casters after her own heart, she’s also got a new selection of Pallowen-themed cantrips on tap for those who are looking to expand their Cantripothy repertoires.

This supplement includes:

New cantrips.
New extraordinary liquors.

boardgame.name: San Jenaro Quarterly Game Digest (Volume 6 - Fall 2020) - The Short Games Digest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Its Fall2020 and that means another volume of the Short Games Digest, which makes 6! We bring you another themed issue this time, focusing on building better worlds, reclaiming and reforming institutions and taking us beyond conflict simulation!

Check out some of what we’ve got in store for you:

In Drama Kids, gain supernatural powers and surpass the most challenging mission in your life: high school!
In At last sibling, They are leaving, uncover what happens when a colony dismantles itself responsibly, leaving the First Inhabitants to their own planet.
In Pilgrimage, you play as Couriers delivering vital supplies to communities emerging after ecological collapse. These treks will change you, and will help you to encourage a more just and reflective world.
In the Goblin Wood, you find things you want and lose things you need to save people you love.


And so many more amazing games!!

boardgame.name: The King's Bargain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A journey to the world of the fey and back, betrayal by an evil king, deals with faeries, tragic tales of love and loss, of darkness and justice - it's the stuff legends are made of.

In part 1, Terms of the Deal, the PCs unexpectedly find themselves in the mystical land of Elphyne, the home realm of the fey. They must navigate its dangers, determine why they are there, how it came to be and what they can do about it.

In part 2, A Deal Undone, the PCs must work with the ever-dangerous dark fey to undo the deal which brought them to this strange world and then make an ally who can return them to their home.

These adventures are set in the Isles of the Celts campaign setting, which is a subset of the Pax Lexque campaign world.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Flicks' Family Crypt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flicks' Family Crypt
Swift Adventures are great mini-quests to play on-the-go. These quick system-neutral missions are intended to help you whenever you run out of ideas or come unprepared.

Flicks' Family Crypt

A bit of lore: Viktor Flick doesn't know why or how his dead relatives have come back from the realm of the dead to haunt them. He needs the help of a group of brave heroes to eliminate this threat that endangers the whole town.

boardgame.name: Fioracitta: The Heart of Power
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From a distance, the city shines so brilliantly that you never see the darkness until it is too late to walk away. Her streets are ancient, yet she bristles with the new. She charges the world for what she offers; but for what she offers, you’d sell her both your eyes. The city is Fioracitta, the Heart of Power. And she welcomes all visitors with open arms.

This supplement for Mythras is designed to give the Games Master everything needed to craft adventures or a whole campaign in this setting. The book outlines the city of Fioracitta, the sprawling provincial capital of Lascany, a region in the peninsular nation Itarra, as well as the city’s history, geography, culture, and much more. It contains full guidance for character creation, including several non-human species: the Ophidians, the Longane, the Monacielli, and others. Extensive sections on magic and religion adapt the Mythras core rules to the setting, and throughout are many intrigues, secrets, and agencies to help inform and create compelling adventures.

Fioracitta draws its inspirations from the Italian city states of the late medieval period and the Renaissance, and creates a vibrant fantasy world that is both self contained, or can be used with many of other settings for Mythras, such as Luther Arkwright, Thennla, and even Classic Fantasy.

boardgame.name: Twisted Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never venture in the same old dungeon again.

Twisted Dungeons is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, suited for all levels of play, that will change your dungeons forever.

It’s easy to use: just roll d88 (two eight-sided dice) as the adventure starts, and read the corresponding numbered entry. The book will inject unpredictable events and themes into your dungeon exploration: 64 dungeon complications, ranging from mosquito infestation to teleporting mirrors, from slippery tunnels carved out of ice to chambers with magic-enhancing properties. Most complications will come with interesting rewards, in experience or loot.
Twisted Dungeons may be used alongside its companion volume, Twisted Minions, to create even more random variations. With a bit of common sense, it will work with any book in the Four Against Darkness line.

boardgame.name: Far Beyond Epic: Epic Level Options for Your Campaign
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It seems that there is very little in the way of epic level game enhancements. This document aims to add new feats, spells, and magic items for players beyond 20th level. Some of these may appear as overpowered, but they are geared for epic level characters, after all. Something overpowered for a 25th level character will be grossly underpowered for a 50th level character.

boardgame.name: The Dilettante: A New Base Class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game First Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dilettante is a new base class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Combining martial prowess, sneak attacks, and both arcane and divine spellcasting, the class can fill any niche in a party.

boardgame.name: Gilded Suns: A Victorian Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ENTENTE!

Enter a world of steam and intrigue!

Explore Perthessalus, a world where firearms, airships, and sorcery mix in a steampunk setting. Huge armies clash for honor and glory in the civilized lands, while bandits and marshals duel in the frontier. All the while, technology marches on.

In this book, you will find everything you need to adventure in the world of Perthessalus, including:

The half-catfolk race, a hybrid of elf and catfolk
Five new classes: the engineer, the marine, the medic, the politician, and the ritualist
Statistics for numerous firearms and artillery from the era
A variety of new airships, from small civilian models to the mighty air dreadnought, armed to the teeth with sixteen inch guns
Revised mass combat rules, allowing for larger armies
A gazetteer describing fifteen detailed nations of the world.


This is the world of Perthessalus, the world of the Gilded Suns!

boardgame.name: Gilded Suns: Empires of Honor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Empires of honor. Empires of beauty. Empires of intrigue. Empires of war.

Explore the land of Wa Xing, an aging empire trapped by its own isolation. Immerse yourself in the intrigues of the great civil war wracking Taiyo No Niwa, a land shattered by rebellious samurai and a proud emperor. Adventure in the flying cities of Balam Pipeul. All the while, the nations of Patriam seek to colonize and exploit these mighty empires.

This 66-page gazetteer expands the Gilded Suns Campaign Setting by describing these lands, as well as providing additional rules for mass combat.

Explore the empires of honor!

boardgame.name: Beauty & Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawing power from an ancestor who was petrified, inherited the power of elemental earth or was a being like a medusa, the beauty & stone sorcerer has powerful magic that allows them to interact with the earth and petrification in greater ways. They have a natural charm, see the world as something that should be stilled and can breath life into inanimate objects with greater proficiency than others. This subclass offers new uses for sorcery points, heightened defensive abilities when using magic that boosts your Armor Class and more, including tables for personality traits, flaws and quirks for this subclass.

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 4, Issue 19 - Mar 1995)
boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert

boardgame.name: Hungry Mines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kids have been missing from a summer camp, one of the survivor kids detailed a monster attack but the locals don’t seem to treat it seriously. As expert monster hunters, our main characters know that something is off and it needs to be taken care before something worse happens.

Hungry Mines is a Monster Hunting One Page Adventure, which means it’s a whole story to be played written in a single page. To play you’ll need to have a RPG system, a player to guide the story as the Storyteller and 2 to 5 players to play the roles of the main characters, The Hunters.

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 4, Issue 20 - Apr 1995)
boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert (adventures)

boardgame.name: Savage Tokusatsu: Future Denied
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Break Free of Fate!

Savage Tokusatsu: Future Denied is a three-part mini-campaign for Savage Tokusatsu, which runs in the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition! Take on the role of normal people who have their potential stolen from them by a greedy capitalist who burns it for fuel! With the ability to gain whatever powers you need each time you transform, can you stop this evil plot?

This trilogy was written by RPPR's Aaron Carsten and can be used as a trilogy but can be easily expanded into a full campaign!

What Do I Get?
Buying this product gives you THREE One Sheets that make up the skeleton of a campaign that can be as long or as short as you want it to be!

Episode One: Destiny Cores introduces the setting, stakes, and major characters in a great starter adventurer!
Episode Two: Stolen Fate sees the heroes confronting the villainous organization Steel Fate at their headquarters!
Episode Three: Prophecy's End brings it all to an end as the heroes confront the true mastermind!


What Are You Waiting For? The Future Needs You!

boardgame.name: Ninja
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We graduated from Ninja Tech!

The ninja class, from Ultimate Combat, was written as an alternative to the rogue and almost designed as an early hybrid class, designed from the rogue and monk. And who doesn't like that idea?

We at Tipsy Tabby Publishing have decided on one last hurrah for the Winning Warriors series, and we're putting the ninja class on our surgeon's table!

The new ninja has the ki pool system from the monk, and the backstabbing skills of the rogue. Instead of relying on flanking and trickery, the ninja chooses a victim, and until their quarry dies or escapes, the ninja gains additional dice of damage against them!

Ninja tricks return with new abilities, including some that are outright supernatural! Use of poisons, short-range teleportation, and long-range attacks of earth and wind fill out your arsenal, letting you, once again...

Win the day – with a warrior!

boardgame.name: Noisome Marsh
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the noisome marshes in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Leagues of Cthulhu: Guide to Afghanistan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Frequently conquered but never tamed, Afghanistan keeps its secrets safe ­­­- Until now

A crossroads for cultures and ideas for millennia, Afghanistan and its people are little understood by the great European Powers who fight to bring this land into their empires. Once a center of Zoroastrian and Buddhist learning, there are religions far older than humanity still thriving in the deep valleys and high mountains. Now the veil of ignorance has been lifted and the secret history and ageless lore of this timeless land can be revealed.
This supplement for Leagues of Cthulhu explores Afghanistan in the Late Victorian Era. Contents include:

A history of the region stretching back to the dawn of time.
An overview of the Afghan culture.
A new League of Adventure and eldritch book.
Details on 11 ancient sites, 6 natural features, and 6 settled areas.
Write ups for the Brethren of the Silent Fire, the Darkness from the Void, generic monstrous tentacles, Peachey Carnehan (with the head of Daniel Dravot), stock characters, sample henchmen, and a sample globetrotter.

boardgame.name: Leagues of Cthulhu: Cthulhu Codicil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

CTHULHU HAS RISEN & TERRIFYING SECRETS SHALL BE REVEALED!

Are you ready to step beyond reality and explore the profane lore eldritch Great Old Ones and the wonders of the Dreamlands?

The Cthulhu Codicil adds a wealth of new material to Leagus of Cthulhu, the award-winning game of the Lovecraft Mythos set in the late Victorian Age.

But be warned, for once seen, the elder lore inside this book can never be unlearned.

Step across the tenuous border of reality and inside you’ll find:

New bloodline Talents and a trio of Leagues
A plethora of rituals, tomes, locations, and dread horrors
Expanded advice for playing in the Lovecraft Mythos.
A detailed exploration of the mystical Dreamlands, including rules for dreamers and altering the landscape of the Dreamlands, rituals and tomes unique to that fabled land, a complete gazetteer, and a bestiary of its notable human and inhuman denizens.

boardgame.name: Origins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New methods for fleshing out your character's life and lineage before adventure!

Five Torches Deep: Origins is the fourth official supplement for the best-selling 5e + OSR game, Five Torches Deep. It includes:

A dozen flavorful ancestries
A life path generator
22 lineage traits
8 cultural resources
8 cultural structures
Three new classes


Written, laid out, and designed by Ben and Jessica Dutter, art by Sam Mameli, and sensitivity editing by Pam "the Dovetailor" Punzalan. The book expands character creation options and improves some of the issues inherent in 5e and similar rpgs (especially the explicit and implicit bioessentialism). The book is 17 pages long and in PDF only (with internal hyperlinks and comprehensive bookmarks).

Works great for Five Torches Deep, 5e, or any six-stat OSR-friendly game.

boardgame.name: Inventor Gadgets
boardgame.description:
A card based party game where you combine object and feature cards to create a wacky new invention. You then pitch your invention to the group in hopes to advance your invention to the next round.

Each round you can play the role of the inventor, the buyer, and the marketing agent. During each role you may contribute an additional function, a slogan/catch phrase, or market to a specific target audience.

Each successful contribution may award you royalty money.

In the end the inventor with the most investment capital wins.

A wacky, multi-player party game of outlandish on-the-spot creativity.

boardgame.name: Avocadogs
boardgame.description:
A fast paced game of pun decoding chaos. Each card is a pun pairing two words to create something never before seen. With one pocket-sized, pub-friendly set of cards you can battle your friends in four different ways. The games vary in length, complexity and wildness to suit your every mood.
Each card combines 2 of 6 categories: animals, food, vehicles, body parts, clothing and places
Game 1: Juicy. Players must collect the most sets by picking up cards from the draw pile and stealing from their competitors in turn. Sets can be 5 cards with a single category match or 3 cards with a double category match
Game 2: Natter. A team based party game where players must describe the characters without using any of the words on the card. Followed by rounds using a single word description, and then acting
Game 3: Throwdown. A race to get rid of your cards, by matching one of the categories on your card to one of the piles on the table. Getting a double category match freezes your competitors in place for 5 seconds whilst you continue to play.
Game 4: Ransack. The fastest game option, a set collection game where all players can steal from each others hands whilst other cards continuously appear on the table. The player to collect the most sets of matching category cards wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Steamrolled
boardgame.description:
A game for all types of gamers. Roll custom dice and move your Steampunk inspired wooden pawn onto a betting track. Move up and including your dice roll to maneuver your pawn into a pot winning position or block your opponents from taking the pot.

2 solitaire versions, 4 different variations to play.

For 1-8 players with the ability to add as many players as you want with your own tokens. Each round takes 5-10 minutes and players play as many rounds as they like, or as determined by a dice roll.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Excalibur (Year 6, Issue 38 - Dec 1996)
boardgame.description: 64 pages + 16 pages insert

boardgame.name: Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities
boardgame.description:
The gods will spare no effort to destroy Atlantis. From the hidden depths of the world they have called forth unspeakable terrors, monsters sent to destroy, frighten, and harry the Atlantean effort to save their civilization. But hope is not lost. On Atlantis, as new leaders rise up to answer the challenge, new powers also emerge to save the isle. And the gods have summoned a power even they cannot control, for some of these creatures are more sympathetic to Atlantis than to the cruel and petty gods.

Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities is an expansion for Atlantis Rising (Second Edition) that offers these new challenges:

• Medusa Unleashed, in which the gorgon Medusa turns Atlanteans to stone. Can you break her curse and recruit her to your side?
• The Harpies’s Lair, in which three monstrous, birdlike creatures steal the resources and workers you need to build the Cosmic Gate. Can you defeat the Harpies and win back the treasures found in their lair?
• Between Scylla & Charybdis, in which the monsters that have long doomed sailors leave their narrow straight and terrorize the shores of Atlantis. Can you satisfy their hunger and calm the waters surrounding the isle?

Four new mechanisms are introduced to the game:

• Monsters
• Allies
• Magic Items
• Locations

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Atlantis Rising (Second Edition): Extended Difficulty Mini-Expansion

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities Board Game Expansion by Elf Creek Games. Includes expansion and all unlocked stretch goals. Not a stand-alone game. This is an expansion of Atlantis Rising. Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Honey Scouts
boardgame.description:
It's the annual spring moon, and the hive is abuzz with excitement. The Honeyscout Tournament is open, and every bee is preparing to battle it out for the top prize. As the Chief Honeyscout of your team, uncover locations of fields of flowers and get worker bees to swarm to treasure troves of nectar you have discovered. Get ready for the buzz of your life!

In HoneyScouts, you place hex tiles to match colors (essentially building the hive), and every time you match a color, you draft a card that gives the location of a flower, with the number indicating the distance between you (the bee) and the flower. When you match colors on the hive to create a complete hexagon of one color, you attract a bee to your swarm.

Why do the numbers on the cards matter? Because the game contains a trick-taking mechanism in which you can win bee battles and attract all the bees from an opponent, poaching them to your side. Special tiles and event cards can throw you off balance or be used to your advantage.

In the end, the player who attracts the most bees wins.

boardgame.name: Crime Zoom: Bird of Ill Omen
Crime Zoom: Oiseau de malheur
Crime Zoom: Ongeluksvogel
Crime Zoom: Ptaki złej wróżby
Crime Zoom: Vögel des Unheils
Zaostřeno na zločin: Posel špatných zpráv
偵探焦點：厄運鳥
boardgame.description:
Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

Each investigation propels you into a different universe, but almost always on a crime scene.

This crime scene is spread over several cards to form a great illustration. To investigate, nothing more simple. Take a card to take a closer look. An item intrigues you ? Flip the card over and find out what is this little paper on the bedside table.

An address ? You can now take the card that corresponds to this track. Unless another element on the crime scene appeals you even more ?

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty ? What is his mobile ? What is the murder weapon ? And some subsidiary questions, of course.

Do not miss the culprit otherwise you will lose the game. But if you answer the questions correctly, the number of cards you will not reveal will decide you.

The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: Oiseau de malheur is the second case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in Paris in 2018.

—description from the publisher
