Crime Zoom: No Furs is the forth case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in London in 2019.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Passport To The Hood Volume_01
boardgame.description:
The 1st of 3 volumes.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) What to do when you see people run
2) A New Yorker’s favorite word
3) What snitches get
4) What the PJ’s mean
5) What not to do at a cookout.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a gold box, 78 trivia cards (categories: THUG Life (8), Entertainment (20), Lifestyle (42), History (8)).

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Passport To The Hood #Trap Edition
boardgame.description:
The 2nd of 3 volumes.
Funny – AF no artificial flavors or colors.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) The type of car dope boys drive
2) What to do if you get hit in school
3) How many times to reuse chicken grease
4) How to play spades
5) How to survive prison.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.
Comes with 4 Passports, a pink box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Trap (21), Entertainment (26), Lifestyle (23), History (8)), plays up to 24 people.

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them on set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (32) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (46) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Passport to The Hood #Feds Watching
boardgame.description:
The 3rd of 3 volumes.
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up.
You are ready to play this game if you know:
1) The best song to start a fight in the club
2) The first thing people do when they get out of jail
3) The type of car to get racially profiled in
4) What’s the best HBCU.
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a blue box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Feds Watching (18), Entertainment (12), Lifestyle (45), History (3)).

Instructions:
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards.
Teams show Decision cards at the same time.
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point.
The majority vote determines the answer.
All of the above is not a valid answer.
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The 7th Citadel: Wooden Card Holders
boardgame.description:
This game accessory provides easy access to:

personal Action Deck.
personal Discard pile.
blocked Skill Cards.
blocked Belongings / Quest item cards.


The card holders are made of birch plywood and are printed in full color.

boardgame.name: Roach Party
boardgame.description:
Roach Party is a fun party board game that mimics the lifestyle of an everyday pot smoker. What many may not know is this game has been around for a long time and you really never hear anything about it.

It was originally released in 1979, right after Cheech & Chong’s first movie, Up in Smoke. Roach Party was sold in head shops when they began popping up in the 80’s. It had great success, sold thousands of copies and was even featured in High Times Magazine. All was good until feds started raiding the shops and merchandise was seized, thus resulting in the disappearance of this really awesome stoner game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate a COMPLETE STASH. This is done by collecting all four of the ROACH CARDS. These include the BAGGIE, PAPERS, FIRE, and SUPPLIER cards.
Lastly you must acquire the funds to pay your supplier. Once you have all four cards and the funds required pay your supplier, you are the winner of Roach Party.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crawl Classics Presents: Blackdirge's Dungeon Denizens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This volume collects more than 100 of the best monsters to appear in Dungeon Crawl Classics adventures, compiled by monster artist? Aeryn “Blackdirge” Rudel. Inside you will find mindless beasts suited to any castle’s catacombs, masterminds who direct hordes under the mountain, raiders from the underdark, champions of the fungal forest, lords of the lava seas, and guardians of long-forgotten tombs. Ranging in CR from 1 to 21, there are enough creatures herein to challenge every adventurer for years to come!

Note: This is the 3.5 version of this compilation. There is also a 4E version available.

boardgame.name: Legend of Zelda Xianxia Cultivation: For Legend of Zelda Arc
The Triune Scriptures
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A set of three Scriptures, inspired by and developed as a tribute to the Golden Goddesses Din, Nayru, and Farore. Each Scripture is separated into the Three Realms, with Three Stages in each Realm, and culminates in achieving a “Golden Essence” which allows the cultivator to shape a full universe as they please. By achieving all three “Golden Essences” one becomes a “Shining Aeon” who may not only form entire universes on a whim but also travel across Nonexistence without a care.

boardgame.name: Fair Game
boardgame.description:
Roll a set of colored dice trying to match combinations on the cards. Be the first to make a combination, and it's Fair Game to take a card -- from the center or from other players. First to collect 4 cards wins the game.

Contents:
24 Dice (4 Sets of 6)
26 Combination Cards
Instructions

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Midtown Mayhem Game Mat
boardgame.description: Upgrade your Marvel: Crisis Protocol tabletop with the Midtown Mayhem Game Mat. This package contains an approximately 3’ x 3’ rubber mat with a slip- resistant bottom. This mat is the ideal companion to the terrain found in the NYC Terrain Pack and perfect for standard-sized games

boardgame.name: Eat, Drink, Maybe Die: Fantasy Consumables For OSR Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not enough to eat, not enough to drink! This one has plenty to satisfy those cravings. 50 "Consumables" for you. Things that you eat, drink, crunch, oil your self with, etc... . Things without charges, things that you just use up and are done with. They may not be magical but you won't notice the difference.

Some Consumables in it:

Awakening Oil, put it on your head in the morning and you may not miss what you've missed. Awaken sleepy one!

Eyeroom, mushrooms that seem like they've grown in your eye sockets. Eat one and you'll learn how to grow your eyes elsewhere.

Happy Flower, something you smoke and it makes you good and happy. Evil leaves your heart and you reap the benefits of other good people near you. Oh what a wonderful world!

Super Sugar, makes you go a little faster and it is soo sweet. Maybe another dose and you'll go even quicker. Better be careful fast guy.

Incredible Healer, at last the secrets of regeneration are revealed! Or are they?

Infernal Snuff, hell's nose treat. Sneeze some lava on your foes.

Poison Repeater, mix it in your poison. One dose, one save, one round is a thing of the past. One dose one save for many rounds.

Protection Sauce, add it to your food and drink. The goblin burger seemed safe to eat but the sauce said it wasn't. Wonder what's wrong with it?

Vampire Clot, sometimes vampires have problems. Umm umm good. A little extra healing from a hit and a little extra protection from the vamps.

ReWe Sticks, hard hard hard to eat. But it gives you a chance to reroll your HP for awhile with better odds of a higher score!

So great Consumer, put that thing with charges in it down and eat something. Eat, Drink, Maybe Die is the menu for your characters. Consume wisely or your character may die!

boardgame.name: The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women
boardgame.description:
The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women

A fun-filled journey highlighting the social, personal and cultural experiences that cultivate the life stories of women.

Play this game and find out what stories you have in common with your friends.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nevermind The Distraction
boardgame.description:
Have you ever tried to meditate? You know that feeling you get when your mind runs off into your consciousness like a racoon digging through a suburban trash can and you just want it to be still? Imagine if that were a game. This is that game. Breathe. Don't let yourself get too distracted!

Nevermind The Distraction was born of a dream to bring meditation and mindfulness to a wider audience in an entertaining and accessible format while still offering serious tools for real mental health improvement. This highly customizable tabletop experience uses the same components for two independent activities and includes several themed Distraction Card sets as well as various tokens and markers.

Part 1, Nevermind, is a card-assisted meditation activity designed to introduce the practice and hopefully bring a little peace and stillness into the player’s life. While this is not intended to replace traditional meditation, the hope is this experience is close enough to open some doorways and bring a little mindfulness into the world.

Part 2, The Distraction, is a meditation-themed solitaire game using the same components as the Nevermind activity. This short, fast-paced game plays like a hybrid of Tug-O-War and Whack-A-Mole where The Watcher (the player) and The Mind (dice A.I.) work at odds to determine the ultimate fate of each Thought card. Release all distractions before time runs out for the ultimate Zen Master win!

For the full experience, both parts can be combined back-to-back and the results of the Nevermind activity will affect the game setup tableau and strategies needed to win The Distraction.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: One Small Step: Metal Dice
boardgame.description:
Heavy (about 11 g each) aluminium 16 mm dice with laser-engraved faces (one grey Agency die, one red Satellite die, one brown Crew die) to be used in addition to the three plastic dice included with the game.

UPC 7-52830-71510-3

Shipped in a small ziploc bag.

boardgame.name: The Powers That Be
boardgame.description:
The time is now for dark secrets to come to light. The world is in chaos and only an elite few know the truth behind the scenes. There is an invisible and powerful force working in the shadows, manipulating the masses to control our world.

Playing as a global elite ruler in 2020, in this hybrid, deck-building / worker placement game, you must first build your cabal by acquiring assets. Then, use your best strategy to attack your enemies and successfully stage events on the global scale. Your goal is to stay invisible, while gaining power over the masses using your best strategy and card based, dice battles.

The winner is the first player to enter the "eye in the triangle" with 13 power points, where you rule the world and no one knows you exist.

The board works like a clock from above, with three dice rolled simultaneously to move the 3 main Board Pieces. The lower level of the board contains the assets, the middle level holds the special cards and the top, zodiac level is for pyramid activation, betting and scoring.
Do you have what it takes to reach the top
of the pyramid and become, The Powers That Be?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Queen Bees
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Nothing is more important than who becomes Prom Queen. Intrigues and drama eliminate the candidates one by one. Go for the crown yourself or at least prevent your rival from getting it!

Keywords: High school-comedy – Ensemble drama – Intrigue

“What is so awesome about Caesar? Brutus is just as cute as Caesar. Brutus is just as smart as Caesar, and people totally like Brutus just as much as they like Caesar, and when did it become okay for one person to be the boss of everybody? We should totally just stab Caesar!”
-Anonymous, BFF to a Prom queen candidate

You are cordial invited to the Prom on John Hughes High.

Towards Prom we need to find a worthy winner of the tiara. This year we have changed the rules, so all of you have the possibility to change from an ugly duckling to a beautiful swan.

Queen Bees is a high school-comedy in which you play fifteen 17-year old teenage girls . They are all members of the five most important cliques, and they all want someone from their group to be crowned prom queen. It’s going to be a struggle full of laughter, tears and rumors. If you can’t get the tiara, then it’s even more important who doesn’t get it.

In Queen Bees you as a player is going to have fun, while the characters tries to out-manoeuvre each other with rumors. All players start with three roles, and in the end each player will only have one left, and there can only be one Prom queen who wears the tiara.

There is both room for a story where the mean girl wins, the classical high school comedy story and even the underdog story, where the most unlikely wins. No matter what the players decide Queen Bees is all about big egos, intrigue, friendship and teenage drama for the roles, while its fun and entertaining for the players. For the roles its extremely serious, but there is room for the players to laugh at the roles short comings and faith.

boardgame.name: Bye Bye Virus
boardgame.description:
INTRODUCTION: There is a virus outbreak in town. Stay safe against virus exposure by dealing with real-life situations. The deck has 3 types of cards: Protect cards, Panic cards, and Power cards.

SETUP: Choose your Deck depending on the number of players. 3 to 3 players, use the Green Deck only while for 4 to 6 players, use the Green and Blue Deck. Shuffle the Deck and place it face down on the table. As you play, throw cards face-up into the Discard pile. HOW TO PLAY: Players start with no cards. Choose any player to start and continue in a clockwise direction. For each turn, draw 1 card from the Deck into your hand. Look at it but do not show it to the others. Choose to pass your turn or play an action by discarding cards face-up into the Discard pile. You can play 1 of 3 actions: Use 1 power card and perform the effect described; or, discard any 3 panic cards to steal 1 card from any player; or, discard 3 of the same cards to pick any 1 card from the Discard pile. IMPORTANT TERMS: To discard a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and throw it into the discard pile. To steal a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and keep it in your hand. To pick a cards: looking at the cards, pick one and keep it in your hand.

HOW TO WIN: At any time in the game, be the first to collect one of each of the five Protect cards and shout "Bye Bye Virus" without getting caught by the Police! Take note of these 2 special power cards: Use the Stay at Home card to replace any Protect card. Use the Police card to stop someone from winning. SPECIAL RULES: All cards lost due to Special Rules are thrown into the Discard pile. Maximum 8 cards in hand: To prevent hoarding, discard any extra cards at the end of your turn. Don't touch your face: Catch any player touching their face and randomly discard one of their cards.

OUR FAVORITE POWER CARDS: There are 12 different Power cards in the deck to make it fun. Government, to Create a new rule, rule breakers to discard a random card. Citizen Watch, to pick a player to recite one of the protect card's advice from memory, if they fail, steal a card. Virus Exposure, pick a player to discard 1 Protect card or to enter quarantine (skip 2 turns). Stay fit, do 10 jumping jacks to draw 1 card. And more...

boardgame.name: Glyffiti
boardgame.description:
Glyffiti is a tile placement game where each player takes the role of an aspiring spellcaster. They work together to cast a city-wide megaspell, while competing to ensure the spell fits their secret agendas.

Players take turns doing one of three actions: Drawing a glyph tile from the bag, playing a glyph tile to the board, or removing a glyph tile from the board. Each glyph has a primary and secondary element, of the classical fire, water, air, earth, or spirit.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives three agenda cards, of which they choose one to keep. This card lists how the player will score at the end of the game. They will gain points for some element types, and lose points for others. Score is based on what elements are present in the outer five spaces when all ten spaces are filled.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Wizkrieg
boardgame.description:
Wizkrieg is a fantasy hex and counter game for 1-6 players. There are 10 human clans and 10 other races, total 20 factions in the game world. Each faction has unique heroes with various skills who may lead army in battle or do quests to collect treasures or recruit monsters. There are diplomacy features that players may make alliance. This is more like a sandbox game set in a fantasy world where players may create their own scenarios & campaigns for 1-6 players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bluffy Pirates
boardgame.description:
Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.

Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.

The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends. While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... One of your friends starts laughing at your face and you very well know, what's about to come.

boardgame.name: World At War 85: We Shall Hold
boardgame.description:
We Shall Hold is the third volume in the World At War 85 series of games depicting fast and furious platoon-level combat. The game series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, when the Warsaw Pact armies storm across the border of East Germany in a powerful attempt to seize West Germany and the whole of Free Europe.

Covering even more battles on the North German Plain as well as parts of southern West Germany, We Shall Hold includes playing pieces for NATO nationalities forward-deployed toward the border between East and West Germany, or in the second line in southern Germany. NATO units are included representing the Belgian, Dutch, Canadian, and West German armies. Opposing them are units of two of the nations of the Warsaw PACT: the East Germans and the Soviet juggernaut, both deploying vast numbers of tanks and infantry in an attempt to overwhelm NATO’s lines.
Fight hypothetical battles using the stalwart Leopard-C1s and Scimitars of the 4th Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group. Deploy and maneuver Leopard-1s, Scimitars, and Milan-2 armed Jeeps of the Belgian Army. Fiercely defend against hordes of Warsaw PACT armor on the North German Plain using the deadly Leopard-2s of the Dutch Army. Assault the line with long-ranged East Germans T-72 tanks, supported by BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicles, armed with deadly Spandrel anti-tank guided missiles. Mass your Soviet attacking forces for a breakthrough using T-80 main battle tanks, more BMP-2s, Engineers for assault, and self-propelled 120mm mortars.

We provide the scenarios, but YOU are IN COMMAND.

The World At War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits are applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, random formation activation and turn length; direct, indirect, opportunity and anti-aircraft fire; fire and movement, assault, and close air support; all are integrated smoothly into a fast, easy to play system.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: World At War 85 (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

boardgame.name: The Great Barrier Reef Card Game: Scuba Diver Promo
boardgame.description:
3 card KS promo. Includes Scuba Diver, instructions, and a scoring card: Symbiotic.

They came in a slim plastic baggie taped to the base game's box.

If the Reef Card you played would have you pick up the Scuba Diver, you must move the Diver to any other position in the market and take the card from that space instead.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Great Barrier Reef Card Game

boardgame.name: Mole King
몰킹
boardgame.description:
Mole king has a story that finds the greatest mole king.

The ‘mole kings’ of each country that govern peaceful mole kingdoms. One day, they heard a rumor about a land full of gold and silver, and they went on a journey to find the land of gold. As if they had made such a promise, the ‘mole kings’ of each country have gathered on the land of gold. You become a ‘mole king’ to drive out other kingdoms and occupy the land of gold. Who will take over the land of gold and become the best ‘mole king’!

Cute artwork with components and easy tile placement is the strength of this game.

Components are 61 Cards, 20 Gold&Silver tokens, 4 Makers, and 4 Quick reference Cards.

Game Setup, each player takes their color's cards(15), 1 gold token, and 1 reference card. All players flip the reference card to the other side then see the brown border that player has become the start player.
All players draw 4 cards from the deck and place the starting card in the middle of the table.

Gameplay action has only 6 steps.

Return: Take the maker that the player placed in the previous round back to the player's hand.



Placement: Select a card from hand and placed it. Do not place it diagonally.



Acquisition: If the player overlapped card, then gain a silver token per each section overlapped.



Payment: Each Player can get an extra turn by paying 1 gold or 4 silver. After the payment, each player can do step2, and 3 one more time.



Preoccupancy: This last action of the turn. Players can place their maker on the card that the latest place. It doesn't have to be placed on top of your own mole.



Replenishment: After finish, all actions, draw cards from the player's hand to replenish the player's hand back to four.


End of the Game, When a player uses all of their cards, the other players can no longer cover up the sections occupied by any moles as they play their cards, and the game will be continued to play until the last player takes a turn(like a Splender). The player who succeeded in securing the most mole of their player color becomes the winner.

boardgame.name: Age of Trains
boardgame.description:
Age of Trains is a retrofuturistic train game in which you aim to pick up and deliver cargo to and from various locations on the map. The game can be played by 2-5 people (depending on the map used). Finishing it requires playing through a certain number of rounds (also determined by the map used), during which we gain Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end is the winner.

The game’s mechanics revolve around the ‘pick up and deliver’ core - you plan your movement across the hexagonal map board, determine the cargo you want to pick up (originating from both private and public sector), and deliver it to the chosen city or port. The more you deliver, the more you can pick up for future transports. By buying the ‘port stock tiles’ you increase your chance of gaining more Victory Points.

Apart from the map boards (each depicting the real country with the original names on it, but adapted to the game’s mechanics), the game also features:
- the game board (used for determining the players’ actions, monitoring the opponent’s development, and upgrading our train),
- the player’s board (used for monitoring player's progress and the improvements made to the train).
The train’s upgrades are divided into 4 categories (engine, hopper wagon, additional wagons, and hiring a specialist), with each upgrade creating new opportunities for the player. Pair it up with the special cards, allowing you to break some of the rules, and you can be sure that each playthrough will differ and require the players to change their tactics and stay vigilant for the opponents’ moves.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dinosaur World: Water Pack
boardgame.description:
This expansion comes with 6 new dinosaurs species (18 meeples and 6 tiles total!) that add some aquatic variety to your games! All dinos will have heat transfer artwork on both sides of the blue translucent plastic meeple. Which of the dinos is your favorite: Dunkleosteus, Elasmosaurus, Kronosaurus, Mosasaurus, Plesiosasurus, or Plotosaurus?

In addition to these awesome components, this expansion adds some alternate rules to play with. At the beginning of the game, players will draft these aquatic dinos instead of the standard set of dinos. These tiles have special end-game scoring rules on them, steering your strategy in different directions.

The Water Dino pack also introduces the idea of algae into the game. Players will roll an additional, special die when visiting these tiles that provides algae. You'll have to clean all the algae from the water enclosures and keep your aquatic dinos happy in a clean environment or else you'll lose victory points at the end of the game!

Contents:
6 types of dinosaurs (18 color meeples)
6 park tiles
1 algae die
24 algae tokens

-description from kickstarter page

listing.notes:
Opened never played, mint condition.
Thanks for your interest, Jason

boardgame.name: Kamikaze Nanobots
boardgame.description:
Kamikaze Nanobots is a strategic, multi-player, hyper-aggressive, shoot ’em up board game. Carnage and self-destruction are actively encouraged in pursuit of victory.

The aim of the game is to destroy your opponent’s MOTHERSHIP whilst protecting your own.

Players attack and defend using SHIPS filled with NANOBOTS. SHIPS can perform different ACTIONS depending on the number of NANOBOTS onboard.

A player loses the game when a single SHOT hits their MOTHERSHIP’S core.

The game is available to print (3d printer and desktop printer needed).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Maze
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Maze is a flexible, 464-page mega-adventure that easily adapts to OSRs, dungeon crawls, and any d20 system.

The purpose of this massive adventure is twofold: to enjoy "Break the door" one-shot scenes, but then following them up with an overarching plot that offers you myriad possibilities for fun. The essence of the game is to have characters die easily, so only the luckiest, strongest, most clever ones can survive in The Maze's environment and discover its mysteries. Let your characters perform epic deeds, and seek an awesome and legendary last stand.

Additionally, the adventure is a challenge for the Maze Master because they have to roll everything randomly during the session. In an ever-changing Maze, the adventure leans heavily on improvisation (or really careful planning) for both players and Maze Masters.

boardgame.name: The Trails of Cabulech
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 18.23, part of the Lake of Abominations cluster, features a giant snail leaving trails of alchemical slime, a gnoll village, two gnoll race-as-class options, and rules for creating magical items.

boardgame.name: Slow Waters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 07.36 features a frogling-inhabited marsh created by ancient and hidden piece of magitech, originally designed to distill a potent alchemical substance from an underground reservoir. In the years since the device was abandoned it continued to run, flooding the surrounding land and creating the current landscape. This hex contains two frogling race-as-class playable classes, a small dungeon containing the distilling apparatus, and the frogling village.

boardgame.name: The Doom of Cthedrak
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another Hex in the Lake of Abominations cluster, the Doom of Cthedrak features a crashed spaceship from another dimensions inhabited by a scheming naga. The wreckage -- called the Dome of the Library -- received an honerable mention in the 2019 One Page Dungeon Contest. This location also features a small orcish camp, and rules for a standard orc race-as-class as well as an orcish warlock race-as-class option.

boardgame.name: The Deadwoods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Deadwoods hex is another in the Lake of Abominations series. It features a spur of the Darkwood called the Deadwood, ruled by an undead treant, and a small goblin village established at the edge of the Deadwood, hoping that their proximity to such a fell place will grant them a measure of safety from a larger goblin village to the north. It also features two goblin race-as-class options: the goblin warrior and mage, as well as rules on goblin demographics.

boardgame.name: The Basilisk Knights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another hex in the Basilisk Hills cluster, Hex 14.23 features the town of Liwil, home to the Basilisk Knights, a much diminished order dedicated to the protection of the surrounding lands. It includes a map of Liwil with important locations and NPCs noted, an alternate Knight class for use in old-school games, rules on dryads in Absalom, and a half-dryad race-as-class option; the Grove Guardian.

boardgame.name: The Keep of the Troglodytes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another in the Basilisk Hills hexcrawl series, the Keep of the Troglodytes includes the eponymous keep, inhabited by a band of vicious troglodytes. Also includes two race as class troglodyte classes, new spells, and several other encounter locations.

boardgame.name: The River's Source
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 15.21 is another hex in the Basilisk Hills hex cluster, featuring the source of a river and the spirit that dwells within, a unicorn grove and rules for expanding unicorns, and bonus hex containing a mini-dungeon inhabited by morlocks, as well as two morlock race-as-class options.

boardgame.name: The Village of the Owl-Folk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

South of the Lake of the Abominations is a village of owl-people living on the outskirts of a haunted forest. The owl-folk are a race of seers and visionaries, spending much of their time in drug-induced states that bring on prescient trances. This hex includes Highglade, the owl-folk village, the northern tip of the Darkwoods, a haunted forest, rules for drugs and drug addiction, and two race-as-class owlfolk classes.

boardgame.name: The Eyrie of the Eaglefolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This hex -- a neighbor to 15.42, Keep of the Rawhide Gang -- features a monastery of eagle-folk monks perched above a mountain lake containing a portal to the plane of water. includes two race-as-class eaglefolk options as well as rules for generating elemental creatures.

boardgame.name: Forests of Plenty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Forests of Plenty is another hex in the Populated Hexes series drawn from the Lake of Abominations cluster. It features the eponymous hex as well as a bonus hex adjacent to it. These two contain the lair of a medusa and her children, a sounder of aggressive boars, a village of sprites that contains a gateway to the Pallid Fields hexcrawl, and more, including rules for adding spellcasting levels to monsters, and guidelines for determining cost of living requirements for PCs and NPCs of different levels and abilities to help calculate how long it takes to build something.

boardgame.name: The Keep of the Rawhide Gang
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 15.42 in the Populated Hexes series features a brigand keep in the hills to the south of a trade road. It includes a fully fleshed out brigand gang, an alternate brigand character class for use in your Old School Essentials or similar OSR-style game, and expanded rules for adding Brigandry to the thieves' guild options presented in A Guide to Thieves' Guilds.

boardgame.name: Classing Up The Joint
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classing Up the Joint is written for Necrotic Gnome's Old School Essentials but can be easily adapted to any OSR-style game. It provides a basic framework for determining the XP requirements of custom classes.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Wardenwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Things are not always what they seem in the cursed forest near Wardenwood village. Can the characters hold back the primal forces of evil and keep innocents from losing all they hold dear?

The Curse of Wardenwood is a deep woods horror adventure for 7th-level characters. It's a one-shot that takes about 3-5 hours to complete and includes:

A sadistic witch, a prowling werewolf, and a surprise twist
Four new monsters that stalk the haunted woods
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure
High-quality digital maps for use with virtual table tops

boardgame.name: The Horror Within
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone who went to opening night of the Monveau Theater's newest show has gone completely insane. Can the characters uncover the shocking secrets inside the theater and find a way to end the plague of madness without losing their own minds?

The Horror Within is a cosmic horror adventure for 8th-level characters. It's a one-shot that takes about 3-5 hours to complete and includes:

A maddening mystery where the characters' sanity is at risk
A thrilling battle against an Old One in the lost depths of the city
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure
High-quality digital maps for use with virtual table tops

boardgame.name: Beneath The Black Rose
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Rose Inn has a spectral resident prowling its halls and a cultish secret under its floorboards. Can the characters delve beneath the Black Rose and bring closure to a decades-old tragedy?

Beneath The Black Rose is a haunting horror adventure for 6th-level characters. It's a one-shot that takes about 3-5 hours to complete and includes:

A ghostly mystery and a murderous cult
Two new monsters to bedevil your players
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure
High-quality digital maps for use with virtual table tops

boardgame.name: The Snow Stalkers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the members of The Red Drakes adventuring party goes missing with precious cargo, it's up to the characters to find them before a blizzard hits. Can the group survive the grisly revelations waiting for them in the remote peaks of Frostfall Pass?

The Snow Stalkers is an ice-cold horror adventure for 5th-level characters. It's a one-shot that takes about 3-5 hours to complete and includes:

A race against a deadly blizzard and abominable enemies
Three new monsters that relentlessly stalk the characters
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure
High-quality digital maps for use with virtual table tops

boardgame.name: Coast of Thrall (Mythras)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A group of adventurers are allied together on a voyage across the sea. There is a mysterious prisoner aboard who is locked in the brig. He is being transported to Soulbade to be executed for his heinous crimes, so when people start to end up missing who is really to blame? The journey takes the adventurers to the dark city of Soulbade. A city where the shadows have a thousand eyes and a dangerous cult called the Dream Watchers worship a wicked djinn with the power to enslave his victims when they sleep. It is left to the adventurers to save these victims of the slavers. It is up to them to rescue the innocent from those who hold the power to not only enslave the mortal flesh, but the very soul as well.

This adventure is created to allow a GM to use it in almost any Mythras fantasy campaign. The Coast of Thrall includes:

A dangerous 50-page dark fantasy adventure set upon sea and land;
An adventure that should last 8-16 hours depending on play styles;
A mysterious cult to find and expose;
A plethora of NPCs that will bring the adventure to life;
9 new adversaries.

boardgame.name: Invisible Killer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A series of vile murders have threatened the peace and prosperity of the quiet town of Harth. Unable to solve the murders on their own, the town’s Lord turns to the Adventurers to discover the assailant, and stop its murderous rampage. Will the Adventurers be able to find an invisible killer? Or will they reveal an even more dangerous threat hiding just beneath the town’s façade?

Suggested party level: 3-4

boardgame.name: Redburn Battlefield - Haunted
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Refighting the battle for eternity
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of three 30 x 30 map depicting an ancient haunted battlefield. Flowing near the now-marshy Reburn river, the battle that was fought centuries ago is fought every night in spectral form.
Contains day version, and two night versions (one with ghosts, one without)

boardgame.name: Fallscave Outlaw Hideout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rob from the rich, eh?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30 x 30 maps depicting a bandit/ outlaw hideout hidden behind a forest waterfall.
The interior features communal rooms for the outlaws, making use of an old tomb and cave complex. The surface map depicts the river and waterfall in a forest setting.

Hike the famous 46 peaks of the Adirondack Mountains in this fast, unique flip-and-write.

On your turn, choose a shape to add to your path as you move from a randomly-selected entry point to an exit, the same as everyone else. Your turns are simultaneous, but each shape is randomly paired with another activity- birdwatching, foraging, and more. Move past and around mountains to hike them, and gather up symbols as you combo your way to success. Show off your hiking gear through special challenges and explore specific mountains as you achieve personal goals. Along the way, use your extra water to power through extra stretches and modify your turns. The game ends on the 10th, 11th, or 12th turn, depending on if someone exits the park first. Oh, and be sure to check out Mt. Marcy for bonus points! Unique set-ups make each play different as you race to solve this pathing puzzle.

46 is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: New Atami Police Precinct
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Atami is a dangerous place - good job there's a police station in each city district. There's no chance they're more dangerous, is there?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a futuristic cyberpunk city police station, with offices, cells, workrooms and more.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: The Tank Museum
boardgame.description:
The Tank Museum brings history to life, with the world's best collection of tanks and explosive live displays. Our exhibitions tell the story of armoured warfare spanning over 100 years of history. Exploring seven powerful exhibitions, you will come face to face with almost 300 armoured vehicles. This unique collection is regarded as the finest in the world.

Take your pick from 6 exclusive tokens: Tiger I, Tog II, Mark IV, Army Boot, Wrench or Beret and race around board purchasing historic tanks and building tank sheds to drive the competition off the battlefield.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Graveyard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 5e compatible adventure is a tier one adventure where characters rush to reclaim a stolen relic and put a risen hero back to rest.

When grounds-keeper Levi Prisk begins robbing the graves he attends, he never imagined the evil he would awake. When he stole the priceless relic of the local hero Ansvold, however, the undead begin to rise with an army of rats at his command. Can the heroes delve under the mosleum and put the dead to rest, or will Ansvold's corruption spread to unstoppable levels.

This adventure includes:

5 pages of thier one adventure
2 unique stat blocks
2 versions of 3 custom maps with files for VTT use.
2-6 hours of fantastic, horrific fun!

boardgame.name: Pretty Little Lairs Volume 1: The Squid God of Wraith Isle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Squid God of Wraith Isle is a short side trek adventure wherein Player Characters are hired to retrieve a sample of water from a long-sealed temple atop an island peak. The coastline around the island is the domain of vile fish-folk known as Skulp, and the temple holds secrets best left unopened. Maps, illustrations, and text set the stage for a great adventure – all you have to do is make it your own!

Recommended for low-mid (2-5) level characters comprising a party of 3-5 Players.

System Neutral with an Old-School feel, this adventure can be dropped into any fantasy role-playing game or used as inspiration for a larger campaign. Perfect for ocean-themed side quests and land-based island adventures.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Thieves' Dilemma
boardgame.description:
Who's got the money? Who can you trust?

A heist is going down. Thieves want the loot, though it’s safer if their partner is holding the bag. Guards want to recover the loot and get more glory if they recover it themselves. And a detective just wants to know who did it.

This fast-paced game is full of twists and turns just like your favorite heist movie. The gameplay is similar to Love Letter but without any player elimination. You always have one character card and one object card—on your turn you might gain information or even switch characters.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Stargate Roleplaying Game Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

WELCOME TO STARGATE PHOENIX

Greetings, Traveler. You’ve been recruited by Stargate Command to defend the galaxy against the Goa’uld Overlords. Stationed at the secret Phoenix Site, you now embark upon your training within the Stargate program.

Each adventure through the Stargate opens a journey to known and unknown worlds where the future of the civilizations may be decided. Your decision to join our cause is greatly appreciated by the Tau’ri and the peoples of the Milky-Way galaxy.

Getting Started
This Quickstart Guide will serve as your guide. Use it to aid in your training for our explorations, and in battles to come.

The Stargate Roleplaying Game is a sci-fi tabletop game, where you assume the role of a Stargate team member, working from a secret off-world Stargate Program labeled Phoenix Site.

As a member of this SG team, you and your teammates will go on missions - guided by a Gatemaster - to explore new worlds and cultures, obtain new technologies, and fight to preserve freedom across the Milky-way galaxy.

boardgame.name: Broken Reality
boardgame.description:
Broken Reality is a single player adventure game set in a 3D parody of the internet. Players take control of a nameless, faceless user as they explore, solve puzzles, meet quirky characters, and uncover secrets that lurk beneath the web. It is set to release on Steam, November 29th, 2018.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Códex – Necrons
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Necrons
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): コデックス – ネクロン
boardgame.description:
The Necrons are a deathless race of alien androids, rulers of the galaxy in a long-forgotten era. Now, having slumbered in stasis for millennia, they are rising up to conquer it again. Clad in self-repairing bodies of living metal and wielding weapons that harness the most devastating energies of the cosmos, the Necrons are a terrifying enemy. Fearless, relentless, and utterly without mercy, they advance in serried ranks and lay down withering storms of fire fit to annihilate even the mightiest of foes. The hyper-resilient Necron soldiery are supported by murderous specialist units, techno-sorcerous war machines, mindless Canoptek constructs, and shards of shattered star gods. They are led to war by undying nobles wielding weapons of devastating power, driven by the absolute conviction that they are the rightful rulers of the stars. And if the long sleep has reduced many Necrons to mindless monsters, or ravaged their sanity and transformed them into murderous demigods? Such madness only makes them an even greater and more terrible threat.

Codex: Necrons is your essential guide to one of the 41st Millennium's greatest threats – a millennia-old alliance of ancient androids who long ago sacrificed their very essence for greater power. In this book, you'll discover the history of the Necrons, from the very earliest days of the universe, to the War in Heaven, and their awakening, all illustrated with stunning art. Once you've read the lore, you can build your army using a vast suite of rules that bring the Necrons to life, with rules for the dynasties (including ones of your own creation!), datasheets, Stratagems, and much, much more.

This 120-page hardback book contains:

The history of the Necrons – from their ancient origins to the Era Indomitus
Stunning art that brings the lore to life
A showcase of incredibly painted miniatures to inspire your own collection and colour schemes
Crusade rules that let you develop your Necron army in thrilling narrative campaigns
Special abilities and bonuses like Command Protocols for your Necron forces
Datasheets for Necrons units for your reference
Stratagems, Powers of the C'tan, and more!


—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Shipping via USPS Flat Rate, UPS, or Local Pick up in store (343 S. Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211) We are an online AND brick and mortar game shop located in the Los Angeles Area. The store is a labor of love between friends and brought to you by avid gamers. We TRULY appreciate your business! - Blue Gnome Games

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Códex – Space Marines
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): コデックス – スペースマリーン
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): 圣典 – 星际战士
boardgame.description:
The Space Marines are numbered amongst the most elite warriors in the Imperium. Created by the Emperor himself from the genetic material of the demigod Primarchs, they are the ultimate soldiers for a cruel and terrible age. Inside this 208-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Space Marines in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Space Marines, with a look at how these genetically engineered warriors annihilate the enemies of the Emperor with terrible force
A Space Marines bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are available to every every First Founding Chapter, their Successors – including more diverse Chapters such as the Space Wolves, Blood Angels, Dark Angels – and the Deathwatch
Rules for creating your own Successor Chapter Tactics
Rules for upgrading your Characters to members of the Chapter Command – Chapter Ancient, Chapter Champion, Chief Apothecary, Master of Sanctity, Master of the Forge, Chief Librarian, and Chapter Master
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Litanies of Battle, Psychic Disciplines, Chapter Relics, and optional Secondary Objectives that define the ways that the Space Marines wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Space Marines
And more!


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Space Wolves

listing.notes: New and sealed in shrink wrap!

boardgame.name: Quiz OM
boardgame.description:
Do you think you know everything about Olympique de Marseille and you want to challenge your friends on your knowledge of the only French club that is European champion?

This quiz box is made for you!

More than 500 questions divided into 250 cards - answers on the back - are available to play at all levels and at all ages!
Compete against your friends and family and demonstrate the extent of your knowledge about OM: the players, the matches, the managers, the coaches, the anecdotes, the highlights of the club's life, etc ...


Vous croyez tout connaître sur l'Olympique de Marseille et vous voulez défier vos amis sur vos connaissances du seul club français champion d'Europe ?

Cette boîte à quiz est faite pour vous !

Plus de 500 questions réparties en 250 cartes - les réponses sont écrites au dos -, sont proposées pour jouer à tous les niveaux et à tout âge !
Affrontez vos amis et votre famille et démontrez l'étendue de vos connaissances au sujet de l'OM : les joueurs, les matchs, les dirigeants, les entraîneurs, les anecdotes, les moments forts de la vie du club, etc...

boardgame.name: Pays de Caen: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
The game of the Pays de Caen.
From Ouistreham to Argences, from Evrecy to Troarn, discover the country of Caen while having fun.
Nearly 550 questions and photos on various themes such as geography, heritage, history, famous people, current affairs, traditions but also charades and riddles.

And "junior" questions for children, 7+


Le Jeu du Pays de Caen.

De Ouistreham à Argences, de Evrecy à Troarn, découvrez le pays de Caen en vous amusant.
Jeu de société original, local et convivial, à découvrir entre amis ou en famille..
Partez de votre commune et redécouvrez votre territoire en vous amusant.
Près de 550 questions et photos sur des thèmes variés tels que la géographie, le patrimoine, l'histoire, les personnages célèbres, l'actualité, les traditions mais aussi des charades et des devinettes.

Et pour les enfants à partir de 7 ans, des questions "junior".

boardgame.name: Can You Survive Storm Chasing?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're a meteorology student fascinated by storms. But Mother Nature can be unpredictable. Situations can quickly turn deadly when extreme weather is involved. What do you do when, You're in a van full of people and a tornado suddenly appears to be headed right for you? A hurricane gains strength along the Florida coast but you're unable to convince people to leave their homes? A flash flood suddenly strikes, putting you and your friends and family in mortal danger? Experience the life or death dilemmas that face storm chasers. YOU CHOOSE what you'll do next. The choices you make will either lead you to safety or to doom.

boardgame.name: Could You Survive the Jurassic Period?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've just been sucked back in time millions of years! Grasses sway higher than your head. Huge insects swarm the skies and fearsome dinosaurs rule the landscape. Do you think have what it takes to survive in the Jurassic Period? Turn the pages to find out!

boardgame.name: Can You Survive Antarctica?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are surrounded by the vast, unforgiving landscape of the coldest place on Earth: Antarctica. Even during the summer months, bone chilling cold, raging blizzards, and treacherous ice threatens human survival. Will you, Join the race to be the first to reach the South Pole? Attempt to ski across the continent as part of an all female expedition? Study Antarctic plant and animal life as a scientist at a research station? Experience the life or death dilemmas of a place few people ever see. YOU CHOOSE what you'll do next. The choices you make will either lead you to safety or to doom.

boardgame.name: Can You Survive Extreme Mountain Climbing?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

YOU are an experienced mountain climber. Your goal is to reach the top of the world's highest and most dangerous mountains. Will you attempt to: Scale Tanzania's Mount Kilimanjaro? or Climb the Matterhorn in Europe? or Reach the top of the world's highest mountain, Mount Everest? Experience the life-or-death dilemmas of places few people ever see. YOU CHOOSE what you'll do next. The choices you make will either lead you to safety or to doom.

boardgame.name: Could You Survive the Ice Age?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've just been sent many thousands of years back in time. The climate is cold and the landscape is strange. The people you encounter look quite different than modern-day humans. But what worries you most are the fierce saber-toothed cats and the giant wooly mammoths that roam the land. Do you think you have what it takes to survive the last ice age? Turn the pages to find out!

boardgame.name: Could You Survive the New Stone Age?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've suddenly time traveled thousands of years into the past. The world around you looks wild and unfamiliar. The humans you encounter can't understand a word you say. Now they're running at you carrying stone tools! Do you have what it takes to survive in the Stone Age? Turn the pages to find out!

boardgame.name: Could You Survive the Cretaceous Period?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've just been transported back in time. Exotic plants tower above your head, while giant rat-like creatures scuttle around you. What concerns you most, however, are the meat-eating dinosaurs that are the size of a house! Do you think you have what it takes to survive the Cretaceous Period? Turn the pages to find out!

boardgame.name: Can You Survive the Titanic?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a passenger on the most spectacular ocean liner ever built the Titanic. When the ship hits an iceberg and begins to sink, its going to take more than luck to survive. Will you, Try to save lives as a member of the ships medical crew? Protect the children of your wealthy employers? Experience the disaster as a 12 year old boy with inside knowledge of the ship? FACE the life or death dilemmas of the most famous shipwreck in history. YOU CHOOSE what you'll do next. The choices you make will either lead you to safety or to doom.

boardgame.name: Can You Survive Being Lost at Sea?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re in the middle of the ocean. The blazing sun beats down on you mercilessly. There’s water everywhere but you can’t drink it. How will you stay alive until help reaches you? Will you: Work to save yourself and others when your small airplane crashes at sea? Battle a fierce storm as a passenger on a chartered sailboat in the Caribbean? Try to survive alone on a small fishing boat stalled off the coast of Maine?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive an Earthquake?: An Interactive Survival Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re in the middle of one of the most unpredictable natural disasters an earthquake. No place is safe as the ground shudders, shakes, and splits. How will you survive as the world crashes around you? Will you: Experience an earthquake far from civilization in rural Alaska? Be trapped in a large U.S. city during an earthquake? Fight to survive during an earthquake in Japan and the tsunami that follows it?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive a Supervolcano Eruption?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re in the middle of one of the most unpredictable natural disasters an earthquake. No place is safe as the ground shudders, shakes, and splits. How will you survive as the world crashes around you? Will you: Experience an earthquake far from civilization in rural Alaska? Be trapped in a large U.S. city during an earthquake? Fight to survive during an earthquake in Japan and the tsunami that follows it?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive a Virus Outbreak?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Center for Disease Control has issued a warning about an outbreak of a new deadly virus―"Blood Fever." Any person you pass on the street could be a carrier. To make it through the outbreak, you'll have to make the right decisions. When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, can you survive a plague that reaches across the globe?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive an Alien Invasion?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sirens blare and news alerts flash on the TV screen as alien crafts enter Earth's atmosphere. You use to wonder if life existed elsewhere in the universe, but now only one question remains: Are they friendly or hostile? When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, your choices will determine if you survive the alien invasion.

boardgame.name: Can You Survive an Asteroid Strike?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A huge rock hurdles through space on a collision course with Earth. It's enormous, as big as the one that wiped out the dinosaurs. You've got a little more than a day to get to safety. Where will you go? Who will you help―and who will help you? Can you survive the greatest disaster that the human race has ever known?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive an Artificial Intelligence Uprising?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We made our machines too smart. Artificial intelligence has risen up against humanity in a quest to wipe us out entirely. The human race is on the brink, and its hopes may lie with you, a young computer whiz. Will you join your parents―leaders in the field of AI―in an attempt to make peace with the machines? Or will you join a rag-tag group of young geniuses in a desperate mission to shut down the AIs once and for all? When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, the choices you make could mean the difference between life and death.? Can you survive the rise of the computers?

boardgame.name: Nova League
boardgame.description:
Tudor Games is bringing Electric Football to the 35th century with Nova League! A new design by Brian and Geoff Engelstein, Nova League combines quick-playing modern game design with the classic fun that Electric Football has brought to generations of fans since 1947.

Play alternates between the Skill Phase, where you activate the common and special abilities of your team; and the Action Phase where you activate the vibrating board and see the action unfold in front of your eyes!

Nova League features:


12 unique characters, each with a special ability and detailed, custom sculpt.
24” x 13” vibrating playfield
Because of the physics of the vibrating table, the size and shape of the sculpts matters! Place extra pieces, including missiles, ice walls, and teleporters.
All new gameplay that is simple, but not simplistic. Be ready to play in 5 minutes and win in 30!


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Can You Survive in a Dystopia?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is a shell of its former self. Most of the world's population is gone. You're one of the few lucky survivors, but can you trust the people that remain? Or will you face the bleak future on your own? When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, the choices you make could mean the difference between life and death. How long can you survive in a dystopia?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive a Zombie Apocalypse?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A wailing moan. A stumbling walk. A horrid stench. You never thought it could happen, but zombies walk the streets with an unending hunger for flesh. With a single bite or scratch, you'll become one of the undead monsters. When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, will you be able to survive the zombie hordes?

boardgame.name: Can You Survive a Global Blackout?: An Interactive Doomsday Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No computers. No lights. No phones. No running water. The world plunged into darkness and chaos. Could you survive a global blackout? When YOU CHOOSE what to do next, the choices you make could mean the difference between life and death.

boardgame.name: World War II: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everything in this book happened to real people. And YOU CHOOSE what side you’re on and what you do next. The choices you make could lead you to survival or to death. In the You Choose Books set, only YOU can CHOOSE which path you take through history. What will it be?Get ready for an adventure…

boardgame.name: The Civil Rights Movement: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everything in this book happened to real people. And YOU CHOOSE what side you’re on and what you do next. The choices you make could lead you to survival or to death. In the You Choose Books set, only YOU can CHOOSE which path you take through history. What will it be? Get ready for an adventure…

boardgame.name: The Golden Age of Pirates: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

YOU are making your living at sea at a time when pirates ruled the oceans. Will you stick to an honest life or risk everything for the riches and adventure of piracy?

boardgame.name: The California Gold Rush: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a New Englander with a bad case of gold fever. Gold has been discovered in California, and you want to go claim some for yourself. Here's a chance to set off on your own quest for gold. Everything in this book happened to real people, but you are in control now and YOU CHOOSE what you do next. The choices you make could lead you to treasure or trouble. Will you strike it rich?

boardgame.name: World War I: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

World War I has just exploded in Europe. The peace of the entire world is in danger. How will you help? Will you: Join the Belgian resistance movement? Fight as a British Army soldier? Serve as a volunteer with the American Field Service? YOU CHOOSE what to do next. The path you choose can lead to heroism, success, or death. The path you take is up to you.

boardgame.name: The Japanese American Internment: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Describes the events surrounding the internment of Japanese Americans in relocation centers during World War II. The reader's choices reveal the historical details from the perspective of Japanese internees and Caucasians.

boardgame.name: Hoop Godz
boardgame.description: Hoop Godz brings 3-on-3 street basketball to life with this two-player head-to-head tabletop game. Pick your three players to put on the court. Spend JUICE to move, pass, and play action cards. Roll dice in real time against your opponent to find out whose actions are successful by matching icons on the action cards. Take rests to recover JUICE when you're running low. Go into the Red Zone on your turn to earn G.O.A.T. cards that give you special abilities. The first player to score 7 points wins.

boardgame.name: The Revolutionary War: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s the late 1700s. Tensions are brewing between the American colonies and Great Britain. The Revolutionary War is about to begin. Will you: Help the network of patriot spies in your city? OR Fight for independence as a patriot soldier? OR Work to keep the colonies under British rule?

boardgame.name: Coach and Play
Coach and Play: Amiens Football
Coach and Play: Helvetia League
Coach and Play: Russia 2018
Coach and Play: Top 10 – Euro Edition

boardgame.description:
Coach and Play Football
Deal 6 cards to each player and place the rest into 2 piles
The first player to get rid of all his/her cards wins one round
Win 4 Rounds to finish the game and be the champion
Win extra round by collecting 5 players of your team.

Gameplay
Each player places the logo of his team in front of him. The dealer chooses the direction of play (e.g. clockwise). Each player is dealt 6 cards and the remainder of the cards is placed into 2 draw piles. It is forbidden for each player to hide the back of his/her cards. After each round the winner is the dealer and starts the game.

The dealer turns over a top card from one of the 2 piles to begin a discard pile. This is the starting card. The dealer must match this card by playing the same COLOR, same NUMBER, same TEAM or same SPECIAL card. If the player wants to pass or is unable to play, he/she must pick up one card from any pile. This card can be played, or another or the player can pass.

It is possible to play several cards at the same time, if they have same number, same team or same symbol (special cards), regardless of the color(s). It is therefore possible to play combination of number and teams.

Each player can collect his/her 5 players in front of him. It counts as a played card. It is possible to place several players at the same time. These cards are not shuffled at the end of the round, each person keeps his/her own players.

The first to collect his/her 5 players wins one round but it continues if the player still has cards in hand.
If 5 players are collected, all cards are shuffled including all collected cards from each player.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Titanic: An Interactive History Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

YOU are aboard the Titanic, the world’s largest ocean liner. The ship is sinking, and the ocean water is freezing. Will you survive? Do you get on the lifeboat or try to wait it out? Do you come to the rescue of the ship or continue in your path? Everything in this book happened to real people. And YOU CHOOSE what to do next. The choices you make will lead you to life or death.
